accessibility.title: ‚ôø WCAG 2.2 Accessibility Audit
accessibility.description: Comprehensive WCAG 2.2 accessibility audit including alt text, ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, color contrast, focus management, and Next.js specific patterns
accessibility.completed: ‚ôø WCAG 2.2 accessibility audit completed in {{time}} ms

missingAltText.title: Missing Alt Text (WCAG 2.2: 1.1.1)
missingAltText.description: Images found without proper alt attributes. This prevents screen readers from describing images to users.
recommendations: Add descriptive alt attributes to all meaningful images
Use alt="" for purely decorative images
For Next.js, use the Image component with proper alt props
Consider using aria-label for complex images
Ensure alt text describes the image content and context

improperHeadingOrder.title: Improper Heading Structure (WCAG 2.2: 1.3.1)
improperHeadingOrder.description: Heading hierarchy is not properly maintained, making content structure unclear for screen readers.
recommendations: Use headings in sequential order (h1, h2, h3, etc.)
Ensure each page has one h1 element
Do not skip heading levels
Use headings to structure content, not just for styling
Consider using aria-labelledby for complex heading relationships

missingHeadingStructure.title: Missing Heading Structure (WCAG 2.2: 1.3.1)
missingHeadingStructure.description: Pages missing proper heading structure, affecting content navigation for assistive technologies.
recommendations: Add h1 element to identify main page content
Use heading hierarchy to structure content sections
Ensure headings are descriptive and meaningful
Use semantic HTML elements alongside headings

inaccessibleForms.title: Inaccessible Form Elements (WCAG 2.2: 1.3.1, 1.3.5, 3.3.7)
inaccessibleForms.description: Form inputs lacking proper labels, autocomplete attributes, or accessible names.
recommendations: Associate every input with a descriptive label
Use aria-label or aria-labelledby when visual labels are not possible
Add autocomplete attributes to identify input purpose
Provide clear error messages with aria-describedby
Group related inputs with fieldset and legend
Implement proper form validation feedback

keyboardNavigation.title: Keyboard Navigation Issues (WCAG 2.2: 2.1.1, 2.1.4, 2.5.1)
keyboardNavigation.description: Interactive elements not accessible via keyboard or missing proper focus management.
recommendations: Ensure all interactive elements are keyboard accessible
Add keyboard event handlers alongside mouse events
Use proper semantic HTML elements (button, a, input)
Implement logical tab order with tabindex if needed
Provide visible focus indicators
Add single-pointer alternatives for complex gestures
Implement escape mechanisms for triggered content

missingFocusIndicators.title: Missing Focus Indicators (WCAG 2.2: 2.4.7, 2.4.11)
missingFocusIndicators.description: Interactive elements lack visible focus indicators or focus may be obscured.
recommendations: Provide clear focus indicators for all interactive elements
Use :focus-visible for modern focus management
Ensure focus indicators have sufficient contrast (3:1 minimum)
Avoid removing default focus styles without replacement
Ensure focused elements are not obscured by sticky/fixed content
Test focus visibility across different browsers

autoplayMedia.title: Autoplay Media Issues (WCAG 2.2: 2.2.2)
autoplayMedia.description: Media content autoplays without user control, which can be disorienting or distracting.
recommendations: Provide controls for auto-playing media
Allow users to pause, stop, or hide moving content
Limit autoplay duration to 5 seconds or less
Provide clear controls for carousels and sliders
Consider prefers-reduced-motion media query

missingSkipLinks.title: Missing Skip Links (WCAG 2.2: 2.4.1)
missingSkipLinks.description: No skip links found to help keyboard users bypass repetitive content.
recommendations: Add "Skip to main content" link at the beginning of pages
Include skip links for navigation and other repetitive blocks
Ensure skip links are keyboard accessible
Make skip links visible on focus or always visible
Test skip link functionality with keyboard navigation

missingPageTitles.title: Missing Page Titles (WCAG 2.2: 2.4.2)
missingPageTitles.description: Pages lack proper titles, making navigation difficult for screen reader users.
recommendations: Add unique, descriptive titles to all pages
Use Next.js Head component or metadata API
Include page hierarchy in titles (e.g., "Page - Section - Site")
Keep titles concise but informative
Update titles dynamically for single-page applications

inaccessibleLinks.title: Inaccessible Link Text (WCAG 2.2: 2.4.4)
inaccessibleLinks.description: Links with vague or missing accessible names make navigation unclear.
recommendations: Use descriptive link text that explains the destination
Avoid generic text like "click here" or "read more"
Provide context with aria-label or aria-describedby when needed
Ensure link purpose is clear from the text alone
Use Next.js Link component for internal navigation

missingAriaLabels.title: Missing ARIA Labels (WCAG 2.2: 4.1.2, 2.5.3)
missingAriaLabels.description: Custom controls lack proper ARIA labels or accessible names.
recommendations: Add aria-label or aria-labelledby to custom controls
Ensure visible label text matches accessible name
Use semantic HTML elements when possible
Provide role attributes for custom widgets
Test with screen readers to verify accessible names

lowContrastColors.title: Potential Color Contrast Issues (WCAG 2.2: 1.4.3, 1.4.11)
lowContrastColors.description: Color combinations may not meet minimum contrast requirements.
recommendations: Test color contrast ratios (4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text)
Use online contrast checkers to verify compliance
Ensure non-text elements have 3:1 contrast with background
Do not rely solely on color to convey information
Consider dark mode and high contrast alternatives

missingLanguageAttributes.title: Missing Language Attributes (WCAG 2.2: 3.1.1)
missingLanguageAttributes.description: Page language not specified, affecting screen reader pronunciation.
recommendations: Add lang attribute to html element
Use locale configuration in Next.js for internationalization
Specify language changes within content using lang attribute
Ensure language codes follow BCP 47 standard

missingLiveRegions.title: Missing Live Regions (WCAG 2.2: 4.1.3)
missingLiveRegions.description: Status messages and dynamic content updates not announced to screen readers.
recommendations: Use aria-live for dynamic content updates
Implement role="alert" for important messages
Use role="status" for less critical updates
Consider aria-atomic for complete message updates
Test status announcements with screen readers

dragDropWithoutAlternatives.title: Drag-Drop Without Alternatives (WCAG 2.2: 2.5.7)
dragDropWithoutAlternatives.description: Drag and drop functionality lacks single-pointer alternatives.
recommendations: Provide keyboard-accessible alternatives to drag-drop
Add buttons for reordering or moving items
Implement arrow key navigation for sortable lists
Use semantic markup with proper ARIA roles
Test functionality with keyboard and assistive technologies

authenticationComplexity.title: Complex Authentication (WCAG 2.2: 3.3.8)
authenticationComplexity.description: Authentication methods may be too complex for users with cognitive disabilities.
recommendations: Provide alternatives to cognitive function tests
Support password managers and autocomplete
Offer multiple authentication methods
Allow copy/paste in password fields
Provide clear instructions and help text
Consider biometric or token-based authentication

improperTableStructure.title: Improper Table Structure (WCAG 2.2: 1.3.1)
improperTableStructure.description: Tables lack proper headers, captions, or semantic structure for assistive technologies.
recommendations: Add table headers using <th> elements
Include a descriptive <caption> for complex tables
Use scope attribute on headers for clarity
Consider using <thead>, <tbody>, and <tfoot> for structure
Ensure data tables are not used for layout

missingButtonLabels.title: Missing Button Labels (WCAG 2.2: 1.1.1, 4.1.2)
missingButtonLabels.description: Buttons contain only icons or images without accessible labels.
recommendations: Add aria-label attribute to icon-only buttons
Use aria-labelledby to reference visible text
Include visually hidden text for screen readers
Ensure button purpose is clear to all users
Test with screen readers to verify button descriptions

missingAccessibilityTools.title: Missing Accessibility Tools
missingAccessibilityTools.description: No accessibility testing or linting tools detected in project dependencies.
recommendations: Install eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y for accessibility linting
Add @axe-core/react for runtime accessibility testing
Include @testing-library/jest-dom for accessibility assertions
Configure automated accessibility testing in CI/CD
Consider using react-axe for development

missingInternationalization.title: Missing Internationalization
missingInternationalization.description: No internationalization setup detected, which is important for global accessibility.
recommendations: Consider adding next-intl or react-intl for internationalization
Set up proper language attributes and locale handling
Plan for right-to-left (RTL) language support
Configure date, number, and currency formatting

globalFocusOutlineRemoval.title: Global Focus Outline Removal
globalFocusOutlineRemoval.description: Global CSS removes focus outlines, which are essential for keyboard navigation.
recommendations: Provide alternative focus indicators when removing outlines
Use :focus-visible for modern focus management
Ensure focus indicators meet contrast requirements
Test keyboard navigation thoroughly

missingMotionPreferences.title: Missing Motion Preferences
missingMotionPreferences.description: Animations detected without respecting user motion preferences.
recommendations: Use prefers-reduced-motion media query
Provide options to disable animations
Limit parallax and auto-playing effects
Respect user system preferences

missingColorSchemePreferences.title: Missing Color Scheme Preferences
missingColorSchemePreferences.description: Dark mode styles detected without respecting user color scheme preferences.
recommendations: Use prefers-color-scheme media query
Ensure proper contrast in all color schemes
Test with high contrast mode
Provide manual theme toggle as backup

markdown.title: # Next.js Code Analysis Report
markdown.safeDeletionsDescription: The following files can be safely deleted with high confidence:
